SENT.plain: Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome (KTS) is a congenital disorder characterized by a triad of cutaneous vascular nevi, soft tissue or bony hypertrophy, and varicose veins or venous malformations involving one or more extremities
An incidence of venous thromboembolism of up to 22% has been reported in this disorder
Also reported is the development of chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH) and subsequent death from right ventricular failure
We report the first patient with KTS to undergo a successful pulmonary thromboendarterectomy for CTEPH
